fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# In a GApps-enabled instance, create an issue
# Edit the issue and save

In the history of the isssue, the "Google documents" field is indicated as 'updated' from '[]' to '' (blank).

This also results in false information in activity streams.

fields.description:
- Provision an instance
- Make sure you can log in with admininstrator
- Enable bamboo on the instance "/sw/studio/studio-fireball-105.6/enable-bamboo.sh"
- Wait until jira all services come back up
- Login as admin, go to Builds tab and click on create plan

*Expected*: Create plan screen to show up

*Actual*: No response from server, browser renders white screen.

Videos: 
- http://screencast.com/t/UA38p9lk
- http://screencast.com/t/uGttoEeq

Notes:
- This reproes consistently on new instances provisioned on UC1 after enabling bamboo.
- I stayed logged in for 10 minutes using other applications and still could not get the plan page to show up. What I haven't been able to figure out is the exact condition that fixes the issue: my best guess right now is that after some minutes, if user logs out and then logs back in the page will appear.
- Same thing happens if I have projects defined.
- Bamboo logs:
{code}
http://screencast.com/t/Penn9DvGuA
2011-07-05 11:11:48,470 INFO [TP-Processor11] [AccessLogFilter] admin GET https://studio-qa-105.jira.com/builds/ 170500kb
2011-07-05 11:11:50,615 INFO [TP-Processor9] [AccessLogFilter] admin GET https://studio-qa-105.jira.com/builds/build/admin/create/addPlan.action 163826kb
2011-07-05 11:11:50,739 WARN [TP-Processor9] [DefaultActionInvocation] No result defined for action com.atlassian.studio.bamboo.build.StudioCreateChain and result noProjects
{code}
fields.summary: Bamboo's create plan action returns empty response for some time after enabling bamboo on a UC1 instance

fields.description: On several customer instances we have seen a problem where you cannot change the group memberships of certain users, either through JIRA or Crowd. No error is yielded in the application or in the logs of either Crowd or JIRA, but the change is ignored.
fields.summary: Unable to modify group memberships for particular users

fields.description:
Resetting tab configuration to the default set removes any custom tabs. Although we've warned users in the docs, I think we still need a confirm dialog in the product because they may not read the docs or may not notice it even if they read it.

See attachment for the UI.


UI text for the confirmation dialog:
"Resetting the tabs to the default configuration will delete your custom tabs. Continue?", and then below the message, two buttons with the text "Yes" and "No respectively.

Can we stretch a little bit and detect if users any custom tabs? Then we only throw the confirmation dialog when customisation exists.
fields.summary: Resetting to the default tab configuration deletes custom tabs without warning

fields.description:
Nearly every thing else as multiple upper case letters like "Activity Stream" and "New Feature"

So why not "Administer Project" and "Create New Issue"? (in fact it should be "Create Issue")
fields.summary: Header labels should be in title case

* Any admin user will see that same broken page whenever they try to navigate to the Wiki page in the administration console.

* pwong belongs to the 'manager' group that has the jira-administrator JIRA global permission, but does not have the Confluence Admin global permission. 

*Current behaviour*

*Expected behaviour*
See an "Access Denied" error.

fields.description:
# Add a custom avatar
# open the Avatar picker again, and try to cancel the added custom avatar pic.

Results are demonstrated in the attached video.

What it's returning is a full JIRA page with a form requesting you to confirm that you want to delete the avatar (but you can't see it in the tiny dialog).

Penny verified that it doesn't happen in standard JIRA 4.4 on JAC.
fields.summary: Trying to delete a custom avatar from JIRA loads a full page into the avatar dialog

See [AOD-24453|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-24453].

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
Please bundle the Adptavist Rate Macro in a future version of Studio

fields.description:
Currently only Applinks 2 links exist between the products in Studio. We're finding that certain cross-app functionality will only work with UAL 3 so we should create these links by default instead of Support having to create them when (for example) customers can't load certain gadgets in their Confluence pages.

We should investigate whether it's necessary to use OAuth or if we can get away with something that doesn't prompt users to login and authorise (since this doesn't feel very integrated and requires more work than it used to for users).
fields.summary: Create Applinks 3 (UAL) links between applications

fields.summary: Stack trace after idle session in Confluence

fields.description:
Could someone help me find the source file that contains the UI copy as shown in the attachment?

The text is not clear enough for new users. And does the page title make sense?

The intro blurb should read something along the lines of:

{quote}With commit commands, you can trigger JIRA workflow transitions directly from commit messages, e.g. resolving and closing issues. Configure mappings between commit commands and workflow transitions on this page.{quote}

fields.description:
Screen Recording: http://screencast.com/t/db4BA5Ukx8

- Create a project
- Go to the wiki tab and select the project space
- Click consistently on the wiki tab

*Actual*: Eventually server will response with "System Error Page" with the stack trace below.

Notes:
- Also reproes on: https://studio-nightly.jira-dev.com
- Looks like a race condition that I could repro consistently using FireFox, but for some reason did not fail when running manually with other browsers.
- Only got this error with the wiki tab (while running manually).

fields.summary: Unhandled exception loading wiki (race condition)

fields.description:
TestDelegatingRepositoryPermissionsManager.testThreadOverflow() attempts to provoke an expected failure by kicking off 6 concurrent threads that access repo permissions via a DelegatingRepositoryPermissionsManager with queue size 5. However, it is possible that one or more threads run to completion before the 6th thread is added, thereby causing the test to flake.

Suggest blocking all threads (e.g. using a CountDownLatch) until the expected error is provoked.
fields.summary: Fix flaky TestDelegatingRepositoryPermissionsManager.testThreadOverflow()

fields.description:
It used to be necessary to update the crowd-integration client jar in the application to the version of the crowd server. This is no longer the case since crowd 2.1 the REST/SOAP API should be 100% backward compatible. In fact, doing so may cause runtime errors.

Since the Conf now use embedded crowd, updating or downgrading the crowd client may actually cause runtime errors since crowd embedded has a binary dependency on the crowd client JAR. For example, you will get method no found exceptions if you try to use a 2.2.x client jar with a 2.3.x version of embedded crowd.
fields.summary: The "crowd-integration client" in Confluence should not be updated in studio.

fields.description: JDK 1.6u27 is available on BEAC agents now. We should proactively test Studio against this JDK version to see if there are any issues, and to check whether the escape analysis bug has been fixed.
fields.summary: Test JST trunk with JDK 1.6u27

fields.description:
It would be useful to gather memory usage information during functional test runs so that we can more easily observe the effect of changes such as JDK upgrades.

This could include periodic sampling of resident set size per process, JVM heap maximum and committed, GC information.

Ideally we could present this in an easily scannable chart in Bamboo, and if possible, detect regressions by failing builds when certain metrics fall outside of expected boundaries.
fields.summary: Report JVM & system memory usage in the functional test builds

SVN Commit Hooks not working. Users can commit even without a JIRA issue key for a successful commit.

fields.description:
Simple adding External Gadgets from Jira on the Confluence admin inside a Jira Studio instance, doesn't work.

Steps to reproduce:
* Get a Gadget XML from Jira(i used the Issue Statistics and GreenHopper Hour Burndown Chart)
** https://SOMEHOST.jira.com/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:greenhopper-gadget-hour-burndown-chart/gadgets/greenhopper-hour-burndown-chart.xml
** https://SOMEHOST.jira.com/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:stats-gadget/gadgets/stats-gadget.xml
* Add the Gadget to Confluence
** Administration > Wiki > Configuration > External Gadgets
* Try to add the Gadget to a Confluence page.

The first annoying thing that will happen is that you need to set up the "size" of the Gadget. 
That's ok, just add a "px" after the number, however the insert button will just became available after you click on other field like author or "tap tab" to this field. If you erase the "px" and write again this button will remain "gray" forever

The second is: The preview will "load forever" or simply not show(blank).
fields.summary: Add External Gadgets from Jira to Confluence doesn't work.

fields.description:
The current status is:

{quote}
JIRA 4.4 (Standalone) - Build: 649
JIRA 4.4 (Studio) - Build: 650
{quote}

Which avoid us to proceed with importing an export from Studio JIRA 4.4 into a JIRA 4.4 Standalone, in order to follow the Provide Studio Backups to Customers procedure. 

When trying to import you'll get: "The xml data you are trying to import seems to be from a newer version of JIRA. This will not work.".
fields.summary: Exports from JIRA Studio cannot be imported into downloaded JIRA 4.4

fields.description:
We're a distributed team and I'm very keen that everyone sets an icon that is their own photo, and uses it everywhere as there avatar/profile picture. 

We've just signed up for Jira Studio but although I can set a profile picture for jira and confluence, its not possible to change it for fisheye or crucible.  I know its possible to change this for the standalone fisheye so I assume this is something about the way its integrated into studio.

In an ideal world the profile picture would be set once and used everywhere. 
As a compromise having the ability to explicitly set it in fisheye and crucible would be great.
fields.summary: Ability to set avatar for all areas of Jira Studio (can set for jira, confluence but not fisheye, crucible)

fields.description:
Since the update on August 27, certain issues that have been resolved (or closed) by users in our system show up as Unresolved in the Issue Navigator. 

I have attached several screenshots of various bugs. Sometimes re-opening and then resolving an issue solves the problem, but for now it is impossible to search our issues for which are actually resolved without clicking through to every single issue. 

This is severely impeding our ability to use JIRA to track the status of issues. Is this an overall bug or something affecting only our instance? Please help!
fields.summary: Certain JIRA issues that have been resolved or closed show as "Unresolved" in

fields.description:
The purpose of the Plugin up-to-date Check build is to notify us of plugins that need updating. It should go red if new plugins are detected on PAC. It should not go red if:
- We know we don't want to update the plugin.
- We already have an issue raised to schedule the plugin update.

To solve this, add a whitelist feature to explicitly set expected versions of plugins rather than check for latest on PAC.
fields.summary: Add whitelist feature to "plugin up-to-date check" build

fields.description:
Today we had Confluence on our gapps enabled instances return 500s while the Google's authentication services were out. This caused a storm of alerts and ugly 500 pages shown to users.

This only seemed to happen with Confluence, JIRA did not throw a 500 for this error.

Could you please ensure that Confluence fails gracefully and gives the users a nice error rather than throwing a 500?
fields.summary: Fail gracefully when Google authentication stops working

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
* Create two projects, "Test 1" and "Test 2".
* Copy the default permission scheme to "Test Permission Scheme".
* Edit "Test Permission Scheme" and change the "Browse Projects" permissions to only be for those in the "Developers" role.
* Assign the "Test Permission Scheme" to project "Test 1".
* Create an administrator user that can administer "Test 1" and "Test 2" but is not in the "Developers" role for "Test 1".
* As this user, go to JIRA's project admin screen for "Test 2", it should look and behave OK.
* Then go to JIRA's project admin screen for "Test 1".

Note that the active project in the Studio nav bar is still "Test 2", and the menu on the left still all refers to "Test 2" as well -- which is unexpected. The data and links in the main pane do map to "Test 1" as expected.

This is bad because the user may not notice and click on the sub-menu items for "Test 2" change lots of settings, thinking they're changing it for "Test 1".

See attached screenshot for an illustration of the problem.
fields.summary: Administering a project without the "browse project" permission results in deceptive menus

fields.description:
On the "Elastic Bamboo Configuration" page if we provide wrong AWS credentials (Access Key ID or Secret Access Key), we will get a response page that looks like some serious errors have occurred, and the response doesn't explicitly state that the error is due to wrong credentials being provided.
!Wrong_AWS_ID.png!
fields.summary: Improve error handling for incorrect AWS credentials

fields.description:
We have a bunch of different shell scripts that builds use to deploy fireballs to Unicorn: unicorn-deploy.sh, unicorn-transfer-fireball-local.sh, unicorn-transfer-local.sh, nightly-deploy.sh, unicorn-execute.sh, unicorn-transfer-fireball.sh, unicorn-transfer.sh

In addition, we have the [dev-deploy script|https://sdog.jira.com/wiki/display/JST/Deploying+a+dev+snapshot] that developers use to deploy dev snapshots to Unicorn.

There's quite a bit of overlap here (both amongst the shell scripts, and between the shell scripts and dev_deploy) - would be good to consolidate.
fields.summary: Consolidate scripts that deploy fireballs to Unicorn

fields.description:
{noformat}
<mrose> I think you guys should make the nightly snapshot immutable:
<mrose> instead of having one, have it deploy a new one every day, e.g. studio-nightly-yyyymmdd
<mrose> we give the bamboo job the ability to sync that one particular directory
<mrose> and we also write a script to clean up unused studio nightlies
<mrose> that bamboo can invoke too
<fakraemer> do you suggest that bamboo should do the cleanup as well?
<mrose> well it can invoke the cleanup
<mrose> nightly
<mrose> or we can invoke the cleanup
<fakraemer> sounds like a good improvement, to what should we set the life expectancy of a nightly build?
<mrose> if older than X days and no containers are using it, delete and sync
<mrose> 7 days?
{noformat}

The cleanup could also be improved, since we can identify which Studio version is installed where:

fields.description:
1. Import JIRA Data which has

a JIRA Project which has ISSUES with attachments.
Eg. PROJECT - KOALA (KLA)
With KLA-1, KLA-2 as issues
2. Import attachments too.
Check the /data/jirastudio/jira/home/data/attachments
it shows KLA folder with two sub folders KLA-1 and KLA-2 in it.
-----------------------------------------------------------------

3. On JIRA standalone, delete an issue. Take a backup of this data.
4. Import new JIRA Data in Studio
5. Browsing throught the issues, it does not show the Deleted issue.
6. Check the attachments folder, it still has the folder dedicated for the already deleted issue.
After the stesps 3 - 6, i could still see KLA-1 and KLA-2 folders in attachments folder on Studio.
-------------------------------------------------------------------

6. On JIRA standlone, create a new issue with attachments. Take a backup of this data and a backup of the attachments folder.

Assume that third issue is KLA-3.
and attachments folder has only two folders KLA-1 and KLA-3.
7. Import this new data and attachment into Studio.
8. Notice that Studio would persist the attachments folder for the issues which got deleted.
I notice 3 folders KLA-1, KLA-2, KLA-3 in attachments.

fields.description:
Confluence theme plugin can fail to come up. Seen in build: https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/JST-JST-JOBE-787

Confluence log shows:
{noformat}
2011-08-30 20:12:25,573 ERROR [Spring executor 9] [plugin.osgi.factory.OsgiPlugin] onSpringContextFailed Unable to start the Spring context for plugin com.atlassian.studio.confluence.common
org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanCreationException: Error creating bean with name 'confluencePluginEnabler' defined in URL [bundle://80.0:0/META-INF/spring/atlassian-plugins-components.xml]: Invocation of init method failed; nested exception is java.lang.IllegalStateException: Could not enable plugincom.atlassian.studio.confluence
	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.initializeBean(AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.java:1338)
	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.doCreateBean(AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.java:473)
	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory$1.run(AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.java:409)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.createBean(AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.java:380)
	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractBeanFactory$1.getObject(AbstractBeanFactory.java:264)
	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.DefaultSingletonBeanRegistry.getSingleton(DefaultSingletonBeanRegistry.java:222)
	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractBeanFactory.doGetBean(AbstractBeanFactory.java:261)
	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractBeanFactory.getBean(AbstractBeanFactory.java:185)
	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractBeanFactory.getBean(AbstractBeanFactory.java:164)
	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.DefaultListableBeanFactory.preInstantiateSingletons(DefaultListableBeanFactory.java:429)
	at org.springframework.context.support.AbstractApplicationContext.finishBeanFactoryInitialization(AbstractApplicationContext.java:728)
	at org.springframework.osgi.context.support.AbstractDelegatedExecutionApplicationContext.access$1600(AbstractDelegatedExecutionApplicationContext.java:69)
	at org.springframework.osgi.context.support.AbstractDelegatedExecutionApplicationContext$4.run(AbstractDelegatedExecutionApplicationContext.java:355)
	at org.springframework.osgi.util.internal.PrivilegedUtils.executeWithCustomTCCL(PrivilegedUtils.java:85)
	at org.springframework.osgi.context.support.AbstractDelegatedExecutionApplicationContext.completeRefresh(AbstractDelegatedExecutionApplicationContext.java:320)
	at org.springframework.osgi.extender.internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor$CompleteRefreshTask.run(DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.java:132)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Could not enable plugincom.atlassian.studio.confluence
	at com.atlassian.studio.confluence.common.ConfluencePluginEnabler.enablePlugin(ConfluencePluginEnabler.java:61)
	at com.atlassian.studio.confluence.common.ConfluencePluginEnabler.enableCorrectConfluencePlugin(ConfluencePluginEnabler.java:52)
	at com.atlassian.studio.confluence.common.ConfluencePluginEnabler.afterPropertiesSet(ConfluencePluginEnabler.java:37)
	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.invokeInitMethods(AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.java:1369)
	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.initializeBean(AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.java:1335)
	... 19 more
{noformat}

Immediately after calling pluginController.enablePlugins(), ConfluencePluginEnabler checks pluginAccessor.isPluginEnabled():

{code:java}
    private void enablePlugin(String pluginKey)
    {
        pluginController.enablePlugins(pluginKey);
        if (!pluginAccessor.isPluginEnabled(pluginKey))
        {
            throw new IllegalStateException("Could not enable plugin" + pluginKey);
        }
        log.info("Enabled plugin " + pluginKey);
    }
{code}


This check verifies the plugin state, which seems to be set synchronously via the enablePlugins() call. Therefore, a theory is that another thread is disabling the plugin at the same time. There is no evidence of this in the logs, and there appears to be no logging at the Felix level for the events of interest (in {{org.apache.felix.framework.Felix.stopBundle(BundleImpl, boolean)}}).

If this re-occurs:
* Verify that the enablePlugins() call, when running in conjunction with {{ConfluencePluginManager}}, does indeed behave synchronously. Note that {{ConfluencePluginManager}} does not set the plugin state directly, but listens for an {{ApplicationEvent}} (see {{com.atlassian.confluence.event.ConfluenceEventPublisherManager.publish(Object)}}), which delegates to org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext. From the [Spring doc|http://static.springsource.org/spring/docs/3.1.0.M2/spring-framework-reference/html/beans.html#context-functionality-events]: "You may register as many event listeners as you wish, but note that *by default event listeners receive events synchronously*." - so it *could* be asynchronous.
* Consider implementing a {{BundleListener}} that logs for OSGi events to give us more information about who could be disabling the plugin and why. This logging {{BundleListener}} will not be enabled in time if registerd via Spring DM - it must be enabled via {{BundleActivator}}.
fields.summary: Intermittent IllegalStateException in ConfluencePluginEnabler when enabling confluence theme plugin

fields.description:
Since the recent update, we are facing severe problems with Jira Interface in FF. Some of the noticed issues are as listed:

* Blank Dashboard - Dashboard does not load when someone return to Dashboard from some other location, even after force reloading the page, there is no change.
* Menu - The user/history menu stops to display - even on current page its not working.
* Infinite loading status is displayed on several pages, like - http://componence.jira.com/plugins/servlet/project-config/TST/people .
* Roles are never loaded in FF 6.0 and the Project Lead cannot be changed - because the text field is displaying as a selection list with a single name (current Lead).

NOTE: These issues are checked and re-producible in FF 6.0 (not checked in older versions) but working fine in Chrome 13 and IE 9.

Issue reported in: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-24074
fields.summary: Jira Interface not working properly in FireFox 6

com.atlassian.studio.jira.importer.impl.JiraTrustedAppsMaintainer and com.atlassian.studio.confluence.setup.ConfluenceTrustedAppsMaintainer both seem to set the request timeout to 10 seconds, but com.atlassian.security.auth.trustedapps.TrustedApplication.decode(EncryptedCertificate, HttpServletRequest) still seems to use 1 second for request validation. We should investigate why this setting is not respected or if there's a different setting which needs to be applied. The timeout should be increased to 10 seconds in order to avoid these intermittent failures.

fields.description:
After the August 2011 update yesterday, I noticed that all the custom color settings and the custom logo on our JIRA Studio instance was gone and was restored to default. Raising a support ticket, I got to know that these settings are not backed up and hence the support can't help much in this area. 

I'm in no mans land now and it will probably take me hours to get the original settings restored.

I think it would be in interest of the customers if JIRA Studio keeps a backup of all the settings that can be affected by a product update. I used to think that it was a standard practice in SaaS to have backups of the UI as well before any update. It seems it is not being followed here.
fields.summary: JIRA Studio should backup on such settings like the color schemes and logos for the customers

fields.summary: Error page at the end of a JIRA import using the importer

fields.description:
Some customers are asking us about integration of the tools mentioned on the Summary, with FishEye and Crucible on Studio environment.

Would be interesting if we add these limitations to the Restricted Functions page, as requested by the user Ben:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-23763?focusedCommentId=1964367&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-1964367

There are questions on Answer, but the FishEye/Crucible topic on the Restricted Functions page still seems to be very poor. 

Cheers
Nícolas
fields.summary: Add BitBucket, GitHub and Git restrictions to Restricted Functions page

fields.description:
https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/JST-JST-JOB1-746

Original issue: [AOD-1169|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-1169]

It's testing com.atlassian.studio.confluence.upgrade.UpgradeTo_v18 which seems to create the people directory information for users retrieved by com.atlassian.confluence.user.UserAccessor.getUsersWithConfluenceAccessAsList(). Crowd, JIRA and Confluence get restored (re-imported) on setup, so this might be a timing issue between user creation in Crowd and synchronisation with Confluence.
fields.summary: Fix flaky com.atlassian.studio.functest.tests.group1.TestConfluencePeopleDirectoryPopulation.testUpgradeTask()

fields.description:
The atlassian-wallboard-plugin-1.5.2.jar was bundled with JIRA 4.4 in the August 2011 release. Unfortunately this plugin only became JIRA 4.4 compatible from version 1.6 (see https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/matrix/23983).

As far as we know, the plugin still works except for the Twitter integration.

The plugin should be upgraded to the latest version (1.6.3 at the time of writing).
fields.summary: Wrong version of the Wallboards Plugin bundled with the August 2011 release

fields.description:
h6. To Reproduce
# search for all issues at https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com with a _response_, which I believe is a comment from someone other than the reporter. Click here   https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=%22Date+of+First+Response%22+is+not+empty
# Add the *Date of First Response* column

h6. Expected Result
Date

h6. Actual Result
$datePickerFormatter.format($value)
!datepicker error.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Date of First Response Column displays $datePickerFormatter.format($value)

fields.description:
Assigning issue in GreenHopper bug is not working for collaborators but no problem for developers.

Step to reproduce:
* Create two users with different access with same permission in JIRA project
* Create a ticket in GreenHopper with assignee field visible during GH create screen or assignee field visible in cards
* Try to type any assignable user in the field
** For collaborator user, there won't be any match but in normal JIRA edit mode - this user can assign to others
** For developer user, the assignee field will work as autocomplete field
* For both access levels it is not possible to change the reporter field. The auto complete field will not find any matches.
* Change access level for user with collaborator access to have developer access, you should be able to assign issue in GH board now
fields.summary: Assigning issue in GreenHopper bug is not working correctly

fields.description:
description copied from the supportcase:

Here is what is going on: Jira remembers which application I was last in and
applies it to any project I go to. So, for example, if I go to project A and
click on the "Source" tab, then I navigate away to project B, it will put me
in the "Source" screen in project B, *even if I removed the source tab from
that project.* This policy simply does not work: If I remove an
application's tab, then Jira should understand that I do not use the
application in that project.

The desired behavior is that if the tab for the application is not
available, then the first available tab should be selected.
fields.summary: Jira does not respect removing of tabs when switching between projects

fields.description: Given we bundle the JIRA Wallboard plugin with Studio, which includes the Twitter gadget, we really should be adding http://search.twitter.com/* to the gadget whitelist by default. Especially since customers can't go in and modify the whitelist themselves, and need to raise a support request to get it done.
fields.summary: Add search.twitter.com to JIRA gadget whitelist by default

fields.description:
JIRA Wiki search - steps to reproduce:
1. I search on a specific term that is not at the beginning of a page title (like "sheet").
2. The result set that comes back shows results, but does not have the page I'm looking for.

The problem is that the search results did not include a page called "UATSignupSheet", which contains "sheet" (the text I entered).  This implies that that particular page does not exist or that it does not contain that text.  It would make more sense to me if the results contained that page because the search text is in the title.

fields.description:
In Standalone JIRA, As an Admin:
1. install GH plugin
2. Modify the GH - General Configuration - GreenHopper Listeners and Services -
	Turn on the ' GreenHopper night service'
3. This would show the GH related service 'com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.customfields.GreenHopperRankingJob:job' in the services tab.
4. Take a back up of this JIRA data and import in Studio.

----------------------------

In Studio instance

1. As a sysadmin, Import the backup created in JIRA.
2. As a sysadmin, Verify the GreenHopper - General configuration to check if 'GreenHopper night service' is enabled. It is enabled.
3. As a sysadmin, Check if 'Services' screen shows the GH service, - There is no service related to GH
--------------------------

Since Studio discards all the services of JIRA instance being imported, it discards GH related service too.
Studio should allow import of GH service.
fields.summary: Studio JIRA Import: Importer fails  to import the 'GreenHopper Night Service'

fields.description:
PermissionSynchroniserImpl prints (deliberately) scary messages to the logs when it is asked to do something but the system appears to be in the wrong state for that, for example "Disabled svn authz file does not exist. No attempt to restore permissions can be made. Svn may not be accessible," and "The file will not be replaced with the backup permissions. Access to svn may be incorrect or unavailable."

When the plugin starts up, SvnFishEyeStatusChangeListener tells the PermissionSynchroniser to set the state of SVN to match FE's state. If they already match, then the system is in an unexpected state, so a scary message is logged. This shouldn't happen.
fields.summary: SvnFishEyeStatusChangeListener should check if it needs to toggle SVN status before telling the permission synchroniser to do so

fields.description:
In JIRA Standlone instnace, 44user created following shared filter:
Filter name: 44 user shared filter
Shared With: jira-developers, newgroup

Admin user backed up the data into 44shared.zip

On pc.jira-dev.com, sysadmin performed an import of 44shared.zip

When Admin searches for the filters, the shared filter '44 user shared filter' does not show up.
But, after doing a JIRA Reindex, when Admin searches for the filters, the shared filter shows up.

There is a possibility that 'Re-indexing' was not effective when import happend.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Detailed steps are as following:
1. Imported the attached data 44shared.zip in a clean studio instance - pc.jira-dev.com
2. Configured Access of following users to 'Developer Access'
           - kladev
           - 44user
           - admin 
3. As an Admin user, Search for Filters.
   Search results fetch only two filters one of which is shared. 
   Search result should have fetched two shared filters as result. Shared filter created by user '44user' does not show up.

4. Perform JIRA-Reindex.

5. As and Admin user, search for the filters - Search result returns the shared filter '44 user shared filter' along with others.
fields.summary: Studio JIRA Import - Shared filters not visible to groups after import, until after JIRA re-index.

fields.description:
It is not possible to click links and buttons that are level with the omnibar. This is mitigated by the fix to AOD-2818: the extra padding in the footer means users can always scroll down far enough that the omnibar isn't level with anything - but nonetheless, the issue can cause some confusion.

This recreates on at least FF5 and Chrome 15.
fields.summary: Links level with the omnibar are not clickable
